>Message: 1
> Date: Tue, 25 May 1999 13:36:31 -0400
> From: "Ken Lee" <kenlee@...>
>Subject: Spell Casters of Solusek Ro
>
>In an effort for cooperation of the spell casters on the Solusek Ro server
I
>have created a message board at the following URL:
>
>http://www.InsideTheWeb.com/mbs.cgi/mb533943
>
>Please keep the posts to only those that reside on the Solusek Ro server.
>We're about helping each other in the game (No not twinking and I'm not
even
>gonna open up that can of worms again), acquiring and improving languages,
>questing together, and helping each other in general. Any messages
>derogatory or 'whiny' in general will be immediately removed. This isn't
the
>place to post about what's wrong with the class, or what should be changed.
>Rather how we can help each other with what we've got to work with. : )
>
>Zalbar
>20th Wizard
>Solusek Ro
>
>
>

____
>___________________________________________________________________________
____

>Message: 2
> Date: Tue, 25 May 1999 19:53:38 +0200
> From: Vincent Archer <Vincent.Archer@...>
>Subject: Re: Random comments
>
>According to mstokes:
>> I haven't really noticed any change with roots, as a matter of fact I
>> rooted a /con white tarantula long enough this morning to unload all of
my
>> mana and get the kill without getting a scratch. One thing I have
noticed
>> is that everything happens in batches. I'll go 20 minutes without a
>
>My stance on this is that they probably changed their random number
>generators. I get more "consistent" fizzles and partial resists these days.
>
>> same type of mob. Another example is that my skills won't increases and
>> then I'll get 2 skill increases back to back.5) One other thing to keep
in
>
>They increase pretty regularly for me. I always get 2 increase in
meditation
>on the next meditation after a level increase, and typically maximise
>chanelling and meditation within 15mn of my next level... unless I die
first :)
>Offense and defense get maxed during the level, but I'm falling behind
>in the weapon-specific skills :(
>
>> I think you can advance you throwing skills on /con greens. Can anyone
>> confirm or deny this.
>
>I can confirm. My monk friend got twice combat skills increases on green
>monsters, and no experience from these (as opposed from the rare green
>monster that still yields experience).
>
>> Very good tip, and its true. I've checked it out myself
>
>Got killed by Lord Shin Ree yesterday. Lost 1/3rd of bubble. I had
>regagned it when three blue Orc centurions jumped me (at 1 pixel of 11th
>level). I had a little over a half bubble to regain that time.
>
>> > I've purchased some netted the other day (cape, pants, shawl) and
>> > didn't see any weight or AC advantage over cloth. Is there any
>> > benefit to netted and, if not, what should I be buying?
>>
>> It's lighter, and its free. Also you can sell the gloves to monks for a
>> hefty profit.
>
>Depends. If you are able to wear small size, it's the same weight. Pants
>are lighter, most aren't (shameless plug: go check my EQ treasure chest
>at http://www.frmug.org/eqchest/, which lists all one can use and usually
>where to find it). For a human or erudite caster however, they're uselful.
>Not worth risking one's life for them, but nice.
>
>--
>Vincent ARCHER -=-=- Herve Schauer Consultants -=-=- archer@...
>Tel: +33 1 41 40 97 00 Fax: +33 1 41 40 97 09
> 01 41 40 97 00 01 41 40 97 09
>

>Message: 3
> Date: Tue, 25 May 1999 20:00:34 +0200
> From: Vincent Archer <Vincent.Archer@...>
>Subject: Re: [Q] advancing fighting skills at higher levels
>
>According to Rich Mulawa:
>> I have a 9th level wizard that has been using 2H blunt for her entire
>> life. I would like to try some 1H weapons to free a hand for useful
>
>1 ) pick piercing a the second proficiency. There are much nicer weapons
> available for casters in piercing than in 1h blunt. Slashing is
> out of the question :)
>
>> Can anyone confirm this and/or give suggestions on how at this point
>> (9th) I can improve my 1H fighting skills?
>
>As suggested everywhere, practice while grouped. When the monster is
>engaged, jump on it and whack whack... Just back away when casting becomes
>necessary and then finish it. It usually keeps my offense and defense
maxed,
>and when I decided to pick piercing back at 8th, the piercing had time to
>increase.
>
>--
>Vincent ARCHER -=-=- Herve Schauer Consultants -=-=- archer@...
>Tel: +33 1 41 40 97 00 Fax: +33 1 41 40 97 09
> 01 41 40 97 00 01 41 40 97 09
>
>
>___________________________________________________________________________
____
>___________________________________________________________________________
____
>
>Message: 4
> Date: Tue, 25 May 1999 20:04:49 +0200
> From: Vincent Archer <Vincent.Archer@...>
>Subject: Re: weapons in general
>
>According to Wizard:
>> Lucky hmmm in everquest all is in luck i got nearly 60 plat in one hour
>> when i go in bank and i sell all what i have but it is result of 10 hours
>> of play at 12 and 13 lv. If you got a god loot and all nobles in PAW have
a
>> snakeskin wich you sell for 6 to 10 plat then you have a luck.
>
>At 11 and above, hunt wisps. Preferably at night, and picks wisps that
gives
>off light. The three I have picked so far that were giving off light had
>lightstones (one had a greater) and 1g5 to 3g in cash.
>
>Commonlands have an abundance of wisps. Faydark has some too, and Erud's
>crossing is rumored to have a true nest of the pests.
>--
>Vincent ARCHER -=-=- Herve Schauer Consultants -=-=- archer@...
>Tel: +33 1 41 40 97 00 Fax: +33 1 41 40 97 09

>Message: 5
> Date: Tue, 25 May 1999 22:12:45 +0200
> From: "Karl Hatteland" <karlh@...>
>Subject: Fizzles and faltering spells late in lvl
>
>When I became lvl 12 I went to lavastorm and began to hunt Dragons. Good
>loot and xp. I rooted them and then shoot them. I used Shock of lightning.
>Then when I was half way to lvl 13 the root began to fail. And each time I
>got hurt more and more. And my lightning spell began to fizzel both 4 and 5
>times a row and I had only to run to zone. Now I am a half bubble from lvl
>13 after dieing quite a bit.
>I wonder why the root falters and the Shock of lightning began to fizzle
>when my skill is maxed on lvl and I was almost 13. Not in the start before
>my skill became maxed. Is this to make us wiz harder to lvl?
>
>Thanks for any reply
>
>Avari lvl12 soon 13 Wiz Fenin ro
>And now excelent in Old Erudin
>
>
>
>

>___________________________________________________________________________

>Message: 6
> Date: Tue, 25 May 1999 21:47:02 +0200
> From: Wizard <wizard@...>
>Subject: Re: Thinking about adventuring to Guk tonight- advice needed
>
>I made it to guk without any problem with my 12 lv HE wizard and i died
>there 4 times, in swam dangerus are troll slayers and big kobolt jojo. If
>you hunt frogloks in swamp you find ocasional netted armour from froglock
>and for entering in guk it is worst place in world for trains. first it is
>so easy that somone will start a train and second it is realy bad thing to
>find in front of you a stupid ogre when you have some TUK Knights on tail.
>Only way to survive is to go in with a 6 men party and secure one of dead
>end tunels where you can camp and somone go to bring kills in so you are in
>no danger that somone else will bring a train and also you can put fighters
>in front to block acces to casters ehehe. be ready to use assist on your
>fighters as if you group with a troll or ogre there is no way to circle it
>to get better position or to click on target as you dont see it moust of
>time ehehehhe.
>
>
>
>
>
>
>

>Message: 9
> Date: Tue, 25 May 1999 21:30:09 GMT
> From: "Lim Dul" <sevendegrees@...>
>Subject: adjustments for Wizards?
>
>There is starting to get some interesting suggestions for tweaking the
>Wizard class. Keep 'em coming...way better suggestions than that whole
"ban
>the twinky" idea. :)
>
>Here's something that I found disconcerting last night. I was with a bunch
>of warriors, druids and others inside Dvinn's palace last night. It was my
>first time back there in a long time and so I was pleasantly surprised
>everything was green to me there. Most of the others in the room were
>almost uniform in level 14-19...maybe about 10 of us in the room.
>
>Anyway...it has been a dream in my young Wizard life to give some payback
to
>Dvinn for the hassle he had given me when I was younger. I was one of the
>higher level guys there being 16lvl...and being the only caster in the
>room...everyone was depending on me to get the damage in while everybody
>else tanked.
>
>Lo and behold...the fighting started and ALL my spells were resisted. We
>managed to take him down anyway...and everybody praised me for my
help...but
>I was so embarrassed I brushed off all the praise and just sulked in the
>corner. :)
>
>I know we've addressed the subject of our spells vrs tombstones before, but
>we are an embarrassingly useless class against red level characters.
>Everything just bounces off. Wonder if Verant should see it fit to adjust
>that a little...maybe even if we just knick the tombstones a *little* it
>would be nice. Even the lower level tanks were contributing at least.
>
>-- Lim'Dul
>
>

>___________________________________________________________________________

>Message: 11
> Date: Wed, 26 May 1999 16:35:36 -0500
> From: Karim <kam@...>
>Subject: Some Verant feedback i got
>
>
>Hello folks,glad i found this community, here is the rant i sent to eq
>god GZ and his response (he responded today).
>All Notes are are my thoughts only,they werent sent in my original
>email.
>
>ME:
>>1/Radiation shield:
>>Our radiation shield is the only combat related spell that we can cast
>>on others,and yet it is worthless past newby initiation.
>>I am lvl 34th now,i see other casters doing slightly less damage than
>>myself with slightly lower damage/mana ratio (magiciants come to mind) ,
>>when i was 24th it was the same with necros ect...even enchanters do
>>have very decent damage/mana ratio
>
>(Note: i wasnt entirelly correct on this one,i realized that only after
>it was too late, but we do get cancel magic that is castable on others
>and is a combat related spell.)
>
>GZ:
> Wizards should not actually get damage shields - this one was
>kept
>in because it was in our origional design doc, and people liked it.
>Wizards
>to have the best damage ratios, the quickest spell casting times and the
>best variety of damage of any class in the game.
>
>ME:
>>Since these classes can do a whole lot more than just damage, isnt it
>>fitting for wizards to have a slight upgrade to our radiation shield?
>
>(Note:GZ didnt answer me on that last one, my point was certain classes
>do almost same damage as us (magiciant do almost same, think, its 7%
>difference at my lvl) but they can do much more than dd,i was pressing
>for anything extra <grin>)
>
>
>ME:
>>2/Gates and evacuates:
>>Is there any difference at all between the mass gate and the evacs?? the
>>duration of the cast seem to be identical,is this a bug that will be
>>fixed?
>
>GZ: Evac is quicker to cast. It also has a chance of leaving
>people
>behind (about a 1% chance).
>
>ME:
>>Mass gates: Many wizards are very diasapointed with the locations of the
>>gates,i know i am. Why have 2 gates in the karanas 2 min from each
>>other?? why are all 3 other gates ro,neriak,and common so close to each
>>other while a vast expense of land is unreachable?
>
> GZ: Teleportation cheapens the game - it makes it easy to get
>around
>(look at UO). We wanted to keep our world big. That is why so few
>classes
>get teleportation.
>
>(note: Druid locations are far superior to ours and much better located,
>guess that is to compensate for the lack of the dimensional planes.also
>and i am not sure if this is true but i hear druid mass gates sometimes
>drop party in a random loc)
>
>ME:
>>Now understand we love mass gating, it is a lot of fun to have special
>>abilities that not many others enjoy, but there are large portion of the
>>norath world that far far from our gates,i wish our gates were more
>>strategically placed. Also i surelly hope you will not forget to include
>>a gate to all future continents.
>
> GZ: Future continents will have gates for sure. :)
>
>
>
>ME:
>>3/Eye of Zomm: this is the most fun in my inventory i get a kick out of
>>using it everytime,but for the life of me i do not understand why it is
>>of such short duration.
>
> GZ: It has a short duration to prevent players from mapping
>dungeons
>with no risk.
>
>(note: i am wondering if he realizes it only last like 15 seconds)
>
>
>ME:
>>4/bind sight: another great fun spell, its only problem is imo way way
>>too short range on pcs, i think it must be bugged that is the only
>>explaination i can come up with. if i binded sight on a player and the
>>player walks away just a short distance all i can see is a static
>>display.
>
> GZ: Hmm - i will check that out.
>
>
>ME:
>>5/Root: wile enchanter whirl seem to have been fixed in such a way as
>>not to break while the mob is taking -bash-damage, i could also point
>>out that root certainly seem to behave the way whirl used to prior to
>>patch.
>
>>From my own experience root seem to last a lot longer if the mob is not
>>taking damage but would tend to break after nuking. If in fact this is
>>true,then doesnt root also need to be fixed in the same way that whirl
>>was? As far as i can see both spells have the same purpose more or less.
>
>GZ: Root has a % chance of breaking when the creature takes
>damage - the
>same as we changed whirl to.
>
>
>>6/Finally my rant would be that wizards arent set that far apart in
>>damage dealing nor in damage/mana efficiency then any of the other
>>casters save maybe shamans (i am only 34th though i havent seen yet what
>>is to come). Yet these other classes can do magical damage and much much
>>more. I must say at this point, only mass gating make me continue to
>>want to be a wizard.
>>
>
>GZ: Try another class for a bit and see the difference in the
>amount of
>time that it takes you to deal out similar damage. :)
>
>
> Geoffrey C.
>Zatkin
> Arch-Magi of Norrath
>
>
>
>
>(Note: well GZ seem to think that because we cast the nukes slightly
>faster that puts us way ahead of the pack, well he is entitled to his
>opinion of course,mine is that the fact that i can cast spells 1 sec
>faster than everyone else is totally worthless.The only advantage that i
>can see is for soloing and i quit doing that long time ago.
>
>He also seem to think that wizard having -almost- same damage/mana
>efficiency as magiciant is quiet ok as long as our damage is dealt
>slightly faster. This really bugs me. i see no purpose whatsoever in
>myself doing a mob 1000 damage in 4 shots vs a magiciant doing it in
>5.With both of us having used the same mana spent. That is suppose to be
>a big asset??
>
>
>Anyways, glad i took the whine of my chest, now at least i know he is
>aware of some of our grivences.)
>
>
> Saltin of Solusek
>
>
>___________________________________________________________________________
____
>___________________________________________________________________________
____
>

doing
>full damage. Dvinn is level 24 (I think) and that's 8 levels more than you.
You
>will always get resisted with such a high difference.
>
>BTW, it's Emperor Crush's castle. Dvinn is an ambassador, although I don't
know
>of who. The Dervishes, maybe? Maybe he's Dorn's older brother?
>

>Message: 22
> Date: Tue, 25 May 1999 19:22:32 -0400
> From: "Stefan Raets" <SRAETS@...>
>Subject: Re: Al's frost spiral...
>
>> I just obtained 12th level and was wondering if it would be
>> worth it to get
>> Al'Kabor's Frost Spiral? I have seen the mana cost at 100!
>> and I have never
>> seen a damage code for it.... Any one want to help me on
>> this one?
>
>It's an AE spell which means that it can damage several mobs at once.
>Only use it when your tank has a few monsters on him. The mana cost
>is higher but since it can damage several mobs at once, it's a good
>deal if you use it in the right situations. It's a good thing to
>always have one AE spell loaded in case you get swarmed by mobs. I
>usually have one AE, one Shock and one Bolt spell in my top three
>slots.
>
>Aznyin
>Level 17 Erudite Wizard
>Chivalric Order of Norrath
>Current Residence: Rivervale [Solusek Ro]

>Message: 25
> Date: Tue, 25 May 1999 18:28:38 -0500
> From: "Marziani, Michael D." <Michael.Marziani@...>
>Subject: Re: Wizards
>
>Don't mean to bash you, but this is *not* a solution. I am at level 16 and
>I notice that the higher I get, the less and less well I fare in melee. I
>have a runed totem staff as well and I can hit ok against blue creatures,
>but against a red where my spells are being resisted I can barely even
>scratch the mob in melee.
>
>Ok, had to start a new paragraph for my rant... Verant is speaking out of
>both sides of their mouth. On one side they encourage us to group saying
>that our root doesn't need to be reliable because we should be grouping.
>But then when we go and form a group that is strong enough to take on reds
>(and lets face it any full group of 6 players can EASILY take on reds that
>will resist offensive spells) we wizards are about as useful as a toddler
>with a stick. At level 16 my only real capability was to free those who
>were rooted and couldnt back off with my cancel magic spell (which almost
>every other magic using class has as well, BTW).
>
>I TOTALLY sympathize with the orignator of this thread. I was in unrest
>last night in a large group and we fought lots of reds that my spells had
no
>effect on. It is the worst feeling to just sit there useless and watch
your
>group getting beat on. I could cast cancel magic (which was only needed on
>1 occasion in 3 hours) and my o'keils radiation (the damage shield I got at
>level 4 which does a measly 2 damage). With my runed totem staff I could
>barely scratch any creature that could resist my spells, so I was basically
>just there sucking xp. Sure against the few evens and blues we faught I
was
>wonderful, but in a group of 6 people you will have to fight blues and
evens
>all day long to get decent xp. Big groups are *supposed* to go after hard
>creatures, yet in these cases the wizard becomes the most useless class
>while EVERY (and I do mean EVERY) other class can still be VERY useful!
>
>Now I won't just cite a problem but also suggest a solution. The solution
>is either to give us weak spells that cannot be resisted (the necros
already
>have one it's the lifetap series), make our DD spells less resisted, but do
>less damage against higher level creatures, or even better still give us
>some utility spells (buffs? damage shields? spheres of protection?) that
>can be cast on party members.
>
>It's not hard for anyone who groups in big groups to see that wizards
become
>the most useless member. It's no wonder it takes hours to find a group
>because a cleric, druid, bard, ranger, warrior, rogue, paladin, magician,
>enchanter, necromancer, or shaman (gee thats every single class isnt it?)
is
>more useful than a wizard when fighting tough monsters in a large group.
>
>Am I just not seeing something right here? Does verant want me to go back
>to soloing? I am very confused here maybe someone else can shed some light
>on this but it sounds like when we do what Verant wants we Wizards get the
>short end of the stick.
>
>-Solric
